description:
oslo.service.Service doesn't provide kill method in it's interface [1].
Nova is implementing it (it removes service record from the DB), but
obviously it isn't actually ever called. This was probably orphaned long
time ago (last changes in 2011).

I think the method should go away.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/master/oslo_service/service.py#L88-L109
title: nova.service.Service.kill() is unused and orphaned

comments.content:
oslo.service.Service doesn't provide kill method in it's interface [1].
Nova is implementing it (it removes service record from the DB), but
obviously it isn't actually ever called. This was probably orphaned long
time ago (last changes in 2011).

I think the method should go away.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/master/oslo_service/service.py#L88-L109
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~roman-dobosz

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/281835
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: I'm not really convinced this is a bug, it's an interface we've got which is fine, even if it's only used by testing. If you want to annotate it as such, that's fine as well.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: Sean, I agree with you, that it's not really a bug, so I'll do what you suggest, and expand the docstring (if this is what you mean by annotating :), within this bug report if it is ok with you.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~roman-dobosz
